benchmark_details.name: SATA-B ENCH (Select All That Apply Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: SATA-B ENCH is a benchmark suite specifically designed to evaluate and enhance the performance of Large Language Models (LLMs) on Select All That Apply (SATA) tasks across diverse domains, reflecting real-world scenarios requiring the identification of multiple correct answers.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the capabilities of LLMs in identifying multiple correct choices in SATA questions and to promote robust decision-making in realistic applications.

data.source: Curated benchmark dataset featuring 1,604 human-validated questions.
data.annotation: Human validation and curation to ensure clarity, diversity, and correct labeling.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on model predictions compared to ground truth answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Exact Match and Precision scores indicate better model performance in identifying all correct answers.
methodology.baseline_results: Top-performing models achieve a maximum exact match of 41.8%.
methodology.validation: Rigorous human validation across multiple cycles of review.
